How to Install brasero on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • brasero

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install brasero on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing brasero on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall brasero in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install brasero, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install brasero Using apt

To install brasero in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install brasero using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install brasero

The installation of brasero might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install brasero Using apt-get

To install brasero using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install brasero.

sudo apt-get -y install brasero

Install brasero Using Synaptic

To install brasero using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install brasero on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for brasero. This will display the brasero package in the package window, now to install brasero, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the brasero package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of brasero.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install brasero Using aptitude

To install brasero on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of brasero.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install brasero using the command aptitude install brasero.

sudo aptitude -y install brasero

How to Upgrade brasero on debian

If you want to upgrade the brasero package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade brasero using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade brasero to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade brasero.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade brasero sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade brasero

Upgrade brasero using Aptitude

To upgrade brasero using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade brasero.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade brasero

Upgrade brasero using Synaptic

To upgrade brasero using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for brasero, now right-click brasero, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade brasero just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall brasero on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall brasero from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just brasero, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove brasero

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of brasero

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of brasero you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge brasero

Remove brasero using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall brasero using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for brasero, right-click the brasero package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall brasero click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install brasero on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade brasero using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
